listing.description: Built at the start of the 18th century on land that originally formed part of the Crown Estate along with what is now Royal Greenwich Park, Park Hall is a handsome red brick Grade II listed building with an enviable and commanding position at the top of Crooms Hill, pressed up against the Royal Park and looking out onto the unspoilt and tranquil western edge of Blackheath. Constructed in 1718 by John James, Park Hall is said to have been the residence of Sir James Thornhill, painter of the ceiling in the Painted Hall of the Royal Naval College. The original facade with subsequent additions circa 1803, its fine red brick with rusticated stucco quoins, heavy stucco cornice mouldings and dental above the second floor are just a few of the features that make this one of the finest examples of 18th/19th-century architecture in Royal Greenwich.Occupying the entire first floor of the freehold building the apartment provides its resident with serene calm and quiet seclusion from its lofty vantage over Crooms Hill. The south-west facing private hardwood roof terrace provides the perfect venue for long, lazy summer lunches and sunset drinks with friends; there are fine views of the Heath to the left, with church spires and glimpses of the Gerkin to the right, all bathed in the resplendent serenity of the 17th century Manor House directly opposite.Built on the summit of the same hill on which stands Greenwich's Royal Observatory, the Park Hall of Georgian England faced directly onto the park and away from what is now the street side of Crooms Hill and the building's current front facade. In the 18th and 19th centuries, residents came to and fro via the quaint and enduring cobbled lane that runs between Park Hall and the upper western gate to the Royal Park. As a result, the original front door to the building is situated at what is now the back of the property, so while the apartment enjoys a first-floor aspect on the Crooms Hillside, it is however not constrained by the associated drawbacks of the typical first-floor property. The apartment constitutes the entire reception level of what was the 18th-century house, including the original main door and hall entrance with three hundred-year-old stone floors and neoclassical columns intact. This unofficial main entrance gives directly onto Park Hall's glorious gardens with south facing aspect, from which walled oasis one must take only a few strolled steps along the cobbled lane before emerging through the ancient Royal walls into the park, or otherwise onto the Heath or street fifty yards further up Crooms Hill than the official entrance to the property.Inside the apartment offers a host of creature comforts. Its marble bathrooms offer a touch of modern opulence, with smartphone-controlled heated floors, wet room walk in shower, deep soaking tub, and luxury period bathroom fittings. The Nero Marquina-Calcutta palette of marble echoes the wet room's long narrow art deco window feature and the 1920s flourishes that quietly augment the building, courtesy of its 1920s division and re-imagining into the five apartments that exist today.High ceilings and generous room sizes recall a bygone era, bestowing upon the resident a way of life rarely enjoyed in 21st century London. The working Edwardian fireplace in the breakfast room pays homage to one of this space's previous incarnations as a parlour or antechamber to the drawing room, yet now as part of an open plan kitchen-dining ensemble, space provides the modern resident with an informal dining area and additional reception in which to entertain.The drawing room boasts a large ornate antique French marble fireplace, intricate period cornice and ceiling rose and the wonderfully warm aged parquet floors that extend throughout all of the non-tiled rooms of the apartment. The master bedroom is adorned with a large black marble Victorian fireplace and fine panelled walls. Similarly, excellent panelling can be found in the formal dining room, which also enjoys the splendour of a fine baroque marble fireplace. There are original working recessed shutters in all windows, and the apartment benefits from extensive shelving, cupboards and window seats built into the panelling and alcoves throughout the apartment, offering convenience and versatility of use. The passageway between the kitchen and the formal dining room can convert into a closet, closing off the room from the kitchen in order to provide the resident with a choice between either an additional reception/formal dining room or a three bedroom, two bathroom set up.This is truly a unique apartment within a unique building, blessed with a location arguably unsurpassed in London. Period character, beauty, elegance and luxurious modern comfort are cocooned within enchanting gardens, sheltered by three-hundred-year-old walls adjacent to the historic Royal Greenwich Park. A super smart, private first-floor residence with the ground floor convenience of garden, park and street access that would be perfect for a future resident at any stage of life. With Greenwich, Cutty Sark and Blackheath stations all within a ten-minute walk, transport to and from Central London, Canary Wharf and London City Airport is very convenient. With the arrival of Crossrail in Woolwich in 2018 getting to Central London or Heathrow Airport from West Greenwich will become swifter still.Get in touch now to book your slot in the upcoming Open Day!

listing.description: This wonderful one bedroom ground floor apartment forms part of an attractive Victorian terrace house. The reception room is found at the front of the property and it's a good size offering lots of natural light due to its bay window and high ceilings. The bedroom is the next room along, it's a sizable double bedroom and has built in wardrobes plus a sash window overlooking views of your private garden. Along the corridor you come to the kitchen which is lovely and light, it has been well designed to accommodate an area for seating and has smart white cupboards for storage plus solid wood worktops giving you plenty of usable space should you love to cook. At the rear of the property is the bathroom, it has been tiled in a neutral tone and is complimented by a modern white suite. The generous garden is private and accessed off the kitchen.The location of this property is very convenient. You have Peckham High Street and Rye Lane within an easy reach in one direction and Queens Road train station in the other which offers services into London Bridge, Victoria & Blackfriars. There are also very good bus network close by with numerous options into Elephant & Castle, Camberwell and central London.

listing.description: A superb detached family home set on Long lane in Ickenham. The property comprises four bedrooms, through living dining room, kitchen, conservatory, utility room and bathroom. There is also the added benefit of a garden room, private garden and driveway.DirectionsFrom our office in Ickenham turn right and at the end of the road at the crossing turn right onto Long lane. The property is a short distance down on the left hand side.SituationLong Lane is a convenient and most sought after location for the modern family, offering access to a number of local amenities including local shops and numerous bus links. Ickenhams Metropolitan and Piccadilly line train station is nearby whilst West Ruislip Central line station is a stroll or short bus journey or drive away.There are a number of highly regarded local schools including Douay Martyrs Secondary and Glebe Primary school. The A40/ M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away along with Uxbridge Town centre with is multitude of shopping facilities, bars and restaurants.DescriptionEnjoying a fantastic location and set on spacious ground is this four bedroom detached house. Creating an immediate impression of comfort, luxury and style the property boasts a great family home with immense potential to further enhance and update making it even more wonderful. Inside the property there is the entrance hall leading to the fitted kitchen, a front aspect living room flowing through to dining room and double doors opening to the light filled conservatory at the rear. From the conservatory there is access to a separate utility room at the side which offers great, invaluable storage space. On the first floor there are four bedrooms and a family bathroom. This really is a great home in a good location in Ickenham.OutsideTo the front of the property is a paved driveway with space for off street parking and a front lawn. To the rear is a low maintenance paved garden to enjoy.
listing.short_description:
A superb detached family home set on Long lane in Ickenham. The property comprises four bedrooms, through living dining room, kitchen, conservatory, utility room and bathroom. There is also the added benefit of a garden room, private garden and driveway.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham turn right and at the end of the road at the crossing turn right onto Long lane. The property is a short distance down on the left hand side.

Situation

Long Lane is a convenient and most sought after location for the modern family, offering access to a number of local amenities including local shops and numerous bus links. Ickenhams Metropolitan and Piccadilly line train station is nearby whilst West Ruislip Central line station is a stroll or short bus journey or drive away.There are a number of highly regarded local schools including Douay Martyrs Secondary and Glebe Primary school. The A40/ M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away along with Uxbridge Town centre with is multitude of shopping facilities, bars and restaurants.

Description

Enjoying a fantastic location and set on spacious ground is this four bedroom detached house. Creating an immediate impression of comfort, luxury and style the property boasts a great family home with immense potential to further enhance and update making it even more wonderful. Inside the property there is the entrance hall leading to the fitted kitchen, a front aspect living room flowing through to dining room and double doors opening to the light filled conservatory at the rear. From the conservatory there is access to a separate utility room at the side which offers great, invaluable storage space. On the first floor there are four bedrooms and a family bathroom. This really is a great home in a good location in Ickenham.

Outside

To the front of the property is a paved driveway with space for off street parking and a front lawn. To the rear is a low maintenance paved garden to enjoy.

listing.description: Launching 'the heights' - Brand new development !We launch on the evening of Thursday 2nd February where we have 28 units to sell. (We sold 54 units at the previous launch).To book an appointment call or email 1 beds from ??295k2 beds from ??360k360 Barking is an exclusive new development set to change the face of Barking. 360 Barking will form an iconic landmark in the town centre, comprising a series of four organically inspired cylindrical buildings complete with private wintergardens and balconies, a rooftop oasis and generous public realm.SituationBy rail, Barking has its own Underground station on the District and Hammersmith & City lines, a main National Rail station with 8 trains per hour at off-peak times terminating at Fenchurch Street in the City, and is also on the London Overground service that runs four trains each hour north westwards terminating at Gospel Oak in North London. In total more than 10 million annual passengers pass through Barking train station, which is accessible from the town centre via a pedestrianised route. A spur of Crossrail has been mooted as a future development, promising to make Barking even better connected than it is already today.OutsideFrom the higher apartments and beautiful communal garden roof terraces you can pick out Canary Wharf, The Shard, The Gherkin, The Cheese Grater and The London Eye to the west. Cast your gaze south across the Thames to the evolving skyline of Barking Riverside, to the north the woodlands of Epping Forest and east to the marshlands and beyond to the Essex coastline.

listing.description: House hunters alert - this delightful & versatile three double bedroom house has a spacious through reception that provides a fantastic family sized living and dining area. A modern fitted kitchen and in the warmer months dinner parties (or barbecues) can spill out into the private rear garden. A head height cellar is unique & would make a great music room or workshop giving a superb and versatile extra space. A large master bedroom of almost 16 sq meters sits beside another decent double room serviced by the modern family bathroom. The second staircase from the 1st floor carries you to the top floor loft conversion where you find your third double bedroom. Deceptively spacious from the front, the facade belies the four storeys of accommodation found inside and the house needs to be viewed to fully appreciate what is on offer. EPC grade E.LocationParking is available in nearby side streets and transport links are excellent with a myriad of bus routes available at Tweedy Road where Bromley North br station is also easily accessible providing links into and out of the City via Grove Park. listing.short_description: House hunters alert - this delightful & versatile three double bedroom house has a spacious through reception that provides a fantastic family sized living and dining area. A modern fitted kitchen and in the warmer months dinner parties (or barbecues) can spill out into the private rear garden. A head height cellar is unique & would make a great music room or workshop giving a superb and versatile extra space. A large master bedroom of almost 16 sq meters sits beside another decent double room serviced by the modern family bathroom. The second staircase from the 1st floor carries you to the top floor loft conversion where you find your third double bedroom. Deceptively spacious from the front, the facade belies the four storeys of accommodation found inside and the house needs to be viewed to fully appreciate what is on offer. EPC grade E.

listing.description: Offers invited in excess of ??850,000.It's all about the view ! This outstanding two bedroom, two bathroom penthouse apartment has the most spectacular, uninterrupted 180 degree views across the rolling greens of Chingford golf course and Epping Forest beyond. With full width panoramic windows and a generous size balcony, you can take full advantage of the magical vista and beautiful sunrise.Built just ten years ago, this select and secure gated development of just 13 highly appointed homes is set in one of the most sought after locations in Chingford within walking distance of Station Road shops, bars and restaurants and Chingford main line station providing access to Liverpool Street in under half an hour.The stylishly planned interior comprises the two double bedrooms both with built in wardrobes and one with en suite bathroom. Each enjoy the benefit of their own individual southerly aspect roof terrace.A second fully tiled shower room is located off the hall which in turn leads to the full width open plan lounge with dining area and kitchen. The German kitchen designed and installed by Urban Myth is comprehensively fitted with base and eye level units with granite work tops and breakfast bar together with a range of integrated appliances including a five ring gas hob, oven, microwave, dishwasher, washing machine and fridge freezer.Externally, the communal grounds include private allocated resident parking.Agents Note : Montgomerie Court has the benefit of solar panelling to help reduce energy costs.

listing.description: A bright and well-presented first floor apartment, set within a gated development. This property is offered with access to a communal roof terrace and benefits from a secure allocated underground parking space. The apartment is neutrally decorated throughout and benefits from an entry phone system, wood flooring and contemporary style fittings. The private front door is situated off a well maintained communal hallway with a lift. Once inside there is an entrance hall with useful storage cupboards that leads through to a bright open plan reception room, the kitchen is modern with contemporary units and integrated kitchen appliances. The apartment is located within close proximity of Wandsworth Town Mainline station, the Tonsleys, Fulham and Wandsworth Common.

listing.description: The Gardens ??? located in East Dulwich/Peckham Rye borderland ??? is a much-envied address of the pretty, quiet and residential variety. Handsome Victorian and Edwardian homes are the order of the day, and the central focus is the large private garden square for residents; being one grants you a key. This ground floor garden flat of 70 square metres (inclusive of a useful cellar) has been carefully and professionally designed and renovated recently, and offers up two bedrooms, a hotel-style bathroom, and a huge reception room that???s open-plan to a modern kitchen which opens out onto a generous garden of almost 40ft. The property also benefits from a posh lighting scheme with 4-setting Lutron system. You???re mere moments from Peckham Rye Park and Common???s 113 acres. Day and night bus routes run along Peckham Rye up to the City and beyond, and your nearest stations are East Dulwich and Peckham Rye stations (the latter is on the London Overground line). On-street parking is available and plentiful. Leasehold.Open the main, original front door into a neat shared hall space. The flat???s own front door sits off to the left. Open into a lobby area, noting classy decor from the off. To your left is a large master bedroom (15ft by 11ft) with huge built-in wardrobes taking an entire wall. A deep bay window is graced with on-trend plantation shutters. The bathroom has large format tiling and contemporary sanitaryware, including wall-hung w.C., and stainless steel fittings. A high-spec. Overbath shower and recessed lightings are further welcome touches. The second bedroom has high ceilings (as you???ll note throughout the property) and French doors that open out to the side return section of the garden. Back to the hall and through, pass the door to the cellar on your right, you open into the centre of the home: A sizeable, solid-wood floored reception and dining room of 16ft by 13ft. Alcove cupboards and shelving sit either side of the chimney breast (of charcoal Venetian plaster finish) with original and working Victorian fireplace. The kitchen lies open-plan to the reception, giving the entire room a double-aspect. The beautifully-planned, slick, modern fitted kitchen is a white affair with built-in appliances. The hexagonally-tiled floor is fabulous. More mostly-glazed French doors open out here to the garden proper this time.The garden is an impressive, largely-tiled, low-maintenance space with generous planting areas, too. A real ???outside room???, if ever there was one! The perfect space for entertaining friends and family. Now???s a good time to mention the side access to the garden (owing to the semi-detached nature of the building). Handy for guests and bikes alike.This is a particularly leafy and quiet part of town that???ll likely leave you never wanting to leave for the country. Peaceful yet well connected though ??? East Dulwich and Peckham Centres are each a short walk (15mins). We love Lordship Lane with its independent shops, pubs and restaurants, and Bellenden Road for the same in a more boutique setting. East Dulwich Picturehouse and Peckham Plex cinema are close, as is The Bussey Building & Copeland Park on Rye Lane (check out The Nines for happy hour cocktails, and Forza Win for friendly Italian dining). Bussey and Frank???s rooftop bars are a must visit in the warmest months. Local foodie restaurants include a handful of our favourites: Peckham Bazaar, Banh Banh, Mr Bao, Miss Tapas and Pedler. Cafe G and Cafe on the Rye are lovely, super local spots for a coffee and pastry, or fry-up.

listing.description: Purchasing this property with A lifetime leaseThis property is offered at a reduced price for the over 60s under Homewise's Home for Life Plan. This is a lifetime lease.The above price represents a mid-range discount from the property's full market value, and is based on a single male applicant aged 69 years. The actual price you will pay depends on your age, personal circumstances and property criteria. Discounts range from 8.5% to 59%.For more information or a personalised quote, just give us a call. Alternatively, if you are under 60 or would like to purchase this property without a lifetime lease at its full market price of ??400,000, please contact Douglas Allen.Property descriptionThis homely yet contemporary style semi-detached home is set in a beautiful peaceful cul-de-sac in North Chingford. On arrival, the character of this home can be appreciated immediately and the impressive size of the driveway is certainly an appealing factor.When stepping into this home you can really get a sense of the stunning natural sunlight that reaches every single room! The lounge/dining area has a stunning clean finish and this makes it one of the most desirable rooms in this home, it???s simply the ideal space to wind down in after a long day at work with your favourite book and a large glass of wine.The kitchen area is a fantastic space with plenty of work top space, giving you the option to have bar stools of your choice or even a small table. Leading on from the kitchen you???ll find the beautifully renovated garden. The patio area steps up onto the greenery which is a perfect space for family barbeques in the summer months.Upstairs on the first floor there are two great size bedrooms and on the second floor there is a loft space that is currently being used as a study area.This home has stunning views of the reservoir, and being within such easy reach of Station Road gives you access to Chingford station and the many boutiques, cafes and other shopping facilities North Chingford has to offer.What the Owner says:We have enjoyed our time in this home but we have decided the time has now come for us to move out of London.We wish the new owners a very happy future here and hope they enjoy the area and home as much as we have.Room sizes:Entrance HallLounge/Dining Area 15'6 x 12'5 (4.73m x 3.79m)Kitchen Area 14'5 x 9'5 (4.40m x 2.87m)Utility RoomBathroomLandingBedroom 1 14'8 x 7'11 (4.47m x 2.41m)Bedroom 2 10'11 x 9'8 (3.33m x 2.95m)Second floorLoft Room 9'6 x 9'0 (2.90m x 2.75m)Off Street ParkingGardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: A unique detached character residence, stylish and immaculately appointed throughout, showcasing impressive contemporary light filled interiors. This property is situated on a large plot at the end of a quiet cul de sac in Ickenham.Potential to extend - Planning permission approved DirectionsFrom our Ickenham Office, turn left and proceed up Swakeleys Road. After the set of traffic lights, take the u-turn and take your first left onto Derwent Avenue. Go straight over the roundabout and take your next left onto Kenbury Close. The property is located at the end of the road on the left hand side.SituationThis property is situated on a large plot at the end of a quiet cul de sac in Ickenham. Located in close proximity to Ickenham High Street which offers a superb range of fashionable shops, cafes and restaurants. This property is in the catchment for and located in close proximity to Breakspear Infant and Junior school and Vyners Secondary school. Local transport links are available from nearby West Ruislip (Central line) or Ickenham tube stations (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) providing reliable links into the City and West End. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties.DescriptionA unique detached character residence, stylish and immaculately appointed throughout, showcasing impressive contemporary light filled interiors. The property comprises an impressive entrance hall, master bedroom with a large bay window, one further double bedroom, a galley styled kitchen which flows into the dining room and a superb living room with double doors opening to the garden. There is a modern bathroom with separate w.C. To the rear of the property there is access to the detached garage and an external utility room. The property is well designed and beautifully presented throughout, it also has planning permission approved for a roof conversion with a large side and rear extension with 2 further bedrooms.OutsideAt the front of the bungalow there is a large paved driveway for off street parking and access to the detached garage. There is also an external utility room. At the rear of the property is a stunning South facing garden with a secluded patio which provides a perfect area to enjoy summer dining and entertaining.
listing.short_description:
A unique detached character residence, stylish and immaculately appointed throughout, showcasing impressive contemporary light filled interiors. This property is situated on a large plot at the end of a quiet cul de sac in Ickenham. Potential to extend - Planning permission approved

Directions

From our Ickenham Office, turn left and proceed up Swakeleys Road. After the set of traffic lights, take the u-turn and take your first left onto Derwent Avenue. Go straight over the roundabout and take your next left onto Kenbury Close. The property is located at the end of the road on the left hand side.

Situation

This property is situated on a large plot at the end of a quiet cul de sac in Ickenham. Located in close proximity to Ickenham High Street which offers a superb range of fashionable shops, cafes and restaurants. This property is in the catchment for and located in close proximity to Breakspear Infant and Junior school and Vyners Secondary school. Local transport links are available from nearby West Ruislip (Central line) or Ickenham tube stations (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) providing reliable links into the City and West End. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties.

Description

A unique detached character residence, stylish and immaculately appointed throughout, showcasing impressive contemporary light filled interiors. The property comprises an impressive entrance hall, master bedroom with a large bay window, one further double bedroom, a galley styled kitchen which flows into the dining room and a superb living room with double doors opening to the garden. There is a modern bathroom with separate w.C. To the rear of the property there is access to the detached garage and an external utility room. The property is well designed and beautifully presented throughout, it also has planning permission approved for a roof conversion with a large side and rear extension with 2 further bedrooms.

Outside

At the front of the bungalow there is a large paved driveway for off street parking and access to the detached garage. There is also an external utility room. At the rear of the property is a stunning South facing garden with a secluded patio which provides a perfect area to enjoy summer dining and entertaining.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or ??420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee ??? From ??440 (Inc. VAT)???

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent ??? To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit ??? Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds ??125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - ??420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of ??54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - ??75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - ??90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - ??150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - ??30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

listing.description: A wonderfully spacious detached family residence, set over four floors, offering over 8000 sq. Ft. Of accommodation and far reaching southerly views. The well presented house includes 7/8 bedrooms, excellent and flexible family/reception/entertaining space, an indoor swimming pool and a superb south-westerly landscaped garden of over 200 ft. That backs onto Coombe Wood Golf Course.The raised ground floor entrance hallway, with storage and guest WC, leads to the drawing room with fireplace, doors to the terrace and connecting access to the dining room and study. The kitchen/breakfast room includes an excellent range of units, integrated appliances and double doors to the conservatory. A second fitted kitchen and family room completes this floor.Further reception space including a media/games room, billiard room, study and gym area, is found on the lower ground floor along with a utility room, guest WC and access to the swimming pool, guest shower room and garage.The first floor, with a wonderful galleried landing/potential for bedroom 8, provides a generous master bedroom suite with good storage and an en-suite bathroom. There are four further bedrooms, two with en-suite shower rooms, and two more bathrooms.The second floor features two more bedrooms, a shower room and extensive eaves storage.SituationGeorge Road is a prestigious private road with substantial houses set in mature grounds situated off Kingston Hill. Local amenities include several high quality golf courses, The All England Lawn Tennis Club and three well equipped riding stables. Richmond Park is easily accessed via Ladderstile Gate or Robin Hood Gate. Nearby Wimbledon Village offers a range of exclusive boutiques, bars and restaurants.Excellent local schools include Kings College, Wimbledon High, Rokeby, Marymount International, Holly Cross, Tiffin, The Hall, Ibstock Place, St Pauls and Putney High. There is also easy access to the American Community School, Swedish, German and Norwegian schools.OutsideThe property sits within generous landscaped grounds which include a carriage driveway with parking, integral garage and a wonderful south-west facing rear garden that extends to over 200 ft. And backs onto Coombe Wood Golf course.
listing.short_description: A wonderfully spacious detached family residence, set over four floors, offering over 8000 sq ft of accommodation. The well presented house includes 7/8 bedrooms, excellent family/entertaining space, an indoor pool and south-westerly garden of over 200 ft. Backing onto Coombe Wood Golf Course.
